reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I drove up the OR/WA coast and decided to find a place to stay along the way. When darkness hit and we were headed to Aberdeen, I checked hotels and found that our sleeping options were limited to motels in the area and a few B&Bs which were priced much higher. I have nothing against motels as long as they are clean and 'not sketchy', so we read a few TA reviews and decided to give the Olympic Inn a shot as we were planning to arrive, sleep, and leave.
reviews.title: A motel I was happy with!

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. I loved the waffle maker in the breakfast room the next morning. If you are in the area or passing through and looking for a place to stay, we'd recommend. It's not the Sheraton, but it isn't portraying itself to be one. Comfortable, clean and convenient. We didn't have any issues with traffic noise, though it was a random Tuesday night.
reviews.title: Decent accomodations for the price.

reviews.text: Since I was traveing alone, I searched for inexpensive but clean accomodatins. This motel is a 60's era tourist court, but it has been upgraded and modernized recently. The room was quite large, the bed was reasonably comfortable, there was a couch and chair and all appeared very clean. The contenential breakfast was adequate, the TV worked well and the Wifi was free.
reviews.title: Not Aberdeen's best.

reviews.text: The front desk people (I think they are family members) were personable.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: For $55.00 + tax it was just fine.
reviews.title: keep Driving
Above average for Aberdeen- good value
reviews.text: The Olympic Inn is one of the larger and better kept motels that I saw in Aberdeen. The lady in the office was super nice, you get a free newspaper, and there is breakfast in the office that includes Belgian waffles. The rooms were large, clean, and well furnished - iron, hair dryer, shampoo, nice towels, tv, wireless internet, microwave, and fridge. I stayed during the week, so it was fairly quiet. However, if you are staying on a weekend, it would be wise to pack earplugs. The Olympic Inn certainly isn't upscale, but It was fine for my needs, and I will stay there again when I next have to do business in Aberdeen.

We were traveling and it was time to find a place to stay. I will tell you that this looked like the best of what we had seen of this town. The price was ok but this place is well woren, needs lots of updates. It was clean, room was big, bathroom was clean. Had an odd odor. I found the staff to be nice, but the area scared me. There were lots of lumberjacks and other working men staying there and the parking lot was tight and hard to park in, but I felt safer knowing alot of working men were staying there.
reviews.title: What a place

likes.liked: — The staff were nice, and the room big.
likes.disliked: — The strange odor and the location.

reviews.text: I have stayed here numerous times and this place is pretty comparable to the old Red Lion in town. The parking can be tight in the high season. The beds are ok. The staff isn't overly friendly. The rooms can use some updates. It is located next to Dennys and down the street from a 24 hour Safeway, incase you get late night munchies. Not the worst place to stay (Aberdeen/Hoquiam has some pretty nasty looking hotels!) but it's not the Guesthouse inn either. All and all this is a cheap place to sleep.
reviews.title: Okay
